title: English (1911) Hexaplar Psalter Bible - Psalms
description:
The "Hexaplar Psalter Bible," a comprehensive compilation of six English translations of the Psalms, was first published in 1911. This remarkable work showcases the evolution of biblical translation through different historical eras. It includes the Coverdale translation (1535), the Great Bible (1539), the Geneva Bible (1560), the Bishops' Bible (1568), the Authorised King James Version (1611), and the Revised Version (1885).

Edited by William Aldis Wright, a distinguished nonconformist writer and critic, this collection is a treasure trove for scholars, theologians, and anyone interested in the study of the Psalms and the art of biblical translation. Wright's work in compiling these translations offers a unique opportunity to observe the nuances and shifts in language, interpretation, and theological emphasis across different versions. The "Hexaplar Psalter Bible" is not just a testament to the enduring significance of the Psalms but also a testament to the rich history of English biblical translation. Its value extends beyond religious study, providing insights into the linguistic and cultural transformations that have shaped the way the biblical text is understood and appreciated over centuries.
